title: In City Press Voices: The age of corruption and deceit; Teachers can’t be replaced; Gender stereotypes must go
text:
Voices In City Press Voices: The age of corruption and deceit; Teachers can’t be replaced; Gender stereotypes must go

Here are some of the opinions in your City Press Voices section today.



Teachers can’t be replaced

No matter how good they may be, machines do not have the social and cognitive skills and they lack empathy to adequately support pupils, writes Chika Sehoole.

The age of corruption and deceit

In its current form, the SA Police Service Crime Intelligence is an oxymoron. Senior crime intelligence officers are consumed with fighting the governing party’s political battles and hiding their own criminal conduct instead of discharging their mandate, says Tebogo Khaas.

Gender stereotypes must go

Dion Chang argues that the country’s deep-seated patriarchy is entrenched by the language we use when raising our children.

We not only enforce gender stereotypes, but also automatically belittle young girls and impose limitations on them.

Sexual offenses courts must be effective

It is only by creating an effective and responsive criminal justice system that survivors of gender-based violence can be encouraged to come forward, write Ohene Yaw Ampofo-Anti and Keyan Leung of Sonke Gender Justice.

. For more on these and other stories, get your copy of City Press today.
